articles.title: Day of Victory of Cuban Revolution Marked
articles.content:
Day of Victory of Cuban Revolution Marked
						
 Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- Cuban Ambassador to the DPRK German Hermin Ferras Alvarez hosted a reception on Wednesday to celebrate the 54th anniversary of the victorious Cuban revolution.
					 Present there on invitation were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Yong Il, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs, Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission who doubles as chairman of the Korean Committee for Solidarity with Cuba, and other officials and diplomatic envoys and military attaches of foreign embassies and representatives of international bodies here.
					
					 Present there were staff members of the Cuban embassy.
					
					 The Cuban ambassador said in his speech that the Cuban people achieved the country's independence through a hard-fought struggle against imperialists on January 1, 1959.
					
					 He referred to the great achievements made by the Cuban people in different fields despite the imperialists' blockade.
					
					 The Cuban people are proud of having particular friendly ties with the heroic Korean people led by Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un, the ambassador said, reiterating the will to boost the friendly relations with the DPRK.
					
					 Yang Hyong Sop said in his speech that the Cuban people have advanced the socialist cause under the correct leadership of the Communist Party of Cuba.
					
					 Yang wished the fraternal Cuban people greater success in their work to implement the decision made at the 6th Congress of the Communist Party of Cuba.
					
					 He said it is the invariable stand of the DPRK government to boost the friendly and cooperative relations with Cuba, adding the Korean people will stand by the Cuban people in the joint struggle for accomplishing the cause of socialism against imperialism.

articles.title: Choe Ryong Hae Makes Field Survey of Reconstruction Project of Turf Research Institute
articles.content:
Choe Ryong Hae Makes Field Survey of Reconstruction Project of Turf Research Institute
						
 Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- Choe Ryong Hae, director of the General Political Bureau of the Korean People's Army, made a field survey of the reconstruction of the Turf Research Institute of the State Academy of Sciences.
					 He encouraged the soldier-builders making innovations in the reconstruction project, true to the high intention of the dear respected Supreme Commander Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He learnt in detail about the construction and supply of building-materials, underscoring the need to introduce rational construction methods suitable for the winter season so as to speed up the project in a qualitative way.
					
					 He told the commanding officers and soldier-builders to properly direct the project and display again the soldier spirit and stamina, bearing in mind the deep trust of the Supreme Commander in them.
					
					 Then he discussed completing the project ahead of the schedule.

articles.title: Delegation of Google Inc. of U.S. Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Delegation of Google Corp. of U.S. Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun 
						
 Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Google Corp. of the U.S. headed by Bill Richardson, former governor of New Mexico State, visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun to pay tribute to Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on Wednesday. 
					 The members of the delegation paid high tribute to the statues of the peerlessly great men. 
					
					 They went round the rooms where the orders they received are on display, mourning hall and the halls housing cars, an electric car, boat and trains which the Generalissimos used during their field guidance and foreign tour till the last moments of their lives. 
					
					 They made entries in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Delegation of Google Corp. of U.S. Tours Pyongyang
articles.content:
Delegation of Google Inc. of U.S. Tours Pyongyang
						
 Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Google Inc. of the U.S. headed by Bill Richardson, former governor of New Mexico State, Wednesday visited the Grand People's Study House here. 
					 The guests went round several reading rooms and lecture rooms, being briefed on the fact that people and students acquire knowledge about modern science and technology and improve their cultural attainments at the study house. 
					
					 They also visited the E-library of Kim Il Sung University, Korean Computer Center, etc.

articles.title: DPRK-China Intergovernmental Committee Meets
articles.content:
DPRK-China Intergovernmental Committee Meets
						
 Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- The 7th meeting of the DPRK-China intergovernmental committee for cooperation in the economy, trade, science and technology took place in Pyongyang on Wednesday.
					 Present there were Ku Pon Thae, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, officials concerned, members of the Chinese government economic and trade delegation headed by Li Jinzao, vice-minister of Commerce, Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Hongcai and his embassy officials.
					
					 The meeting reviewed successes and experience gained in expanding and developing economy and trade between the two countries in the past period and discussed boosting the bilateral cooperation in the future.

articles.title: Agreement on Economic, Technological Cooperation Signed between DPRK, China
articles.content:
Agreement on Economic, Technological Cooperation Signed between DPRK, China 
						
 Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- An agreement on economic and technological cooperation between the governments of the DPRK and China was signed here on Wednesday.
					 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were Ku Pon Thae, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, Ri Chol Sok, vice-chairman of the Commission for Joint Venture and Investment, and officials concerned and from the Chinese side the members of the Chinese government economic and trade delegation headed by Li Jinzao, vice-minister of Commerce, Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Hongcai and his embassy officials.
					
					 Meanwhile, a document on the construction of the office buildings of the management committee of the Rason economic and trade zone and the Hwanggumphyong economic zone was signed.

articles.title: Nepali Party Leaders Express Solidarity with Korean People's Just Cause
articles.content:
Nepali Party Leaders Express Solidarity with Korean People's Just Cause
						
 Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- Nepali party leaders separately met the DPRK ambassador to their country on Jan. 1. They included C. P. Mainali, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist), Jalanath Kanal, chairman of the Central Committee of the Nepal Communist Party (United Marxist-Leninist), and Narayan Man Bijukchhe, chairman of the Central Committee of the Nepal Worker-Peasant Party.
					 The party leaders congratulated the Workers' Party and the Korean people on their proud achievements last year under the wise leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations with the WPK would grow stronger, they extended support and solidarity to the Korean people in their just cause.
					
					 C. P. Mainali said that the Nepali people and other progressive people of the world regarded the DPRK's successful satellite launch as pride and honor.
					
					 The Korean people have achieved steady great progress and successes under the guidance of Kim Jong Un, he noted.
					
					 Jalanath Kanal said that Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address underscored the need to develop the Korean People's Army into a matchless army, adding that this is a precious teaching which all countries should bear in mind and consider as important.
					
					 He reiterated his party's stand that Korea should be reunified in a peaceful way without fail through the implementation of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					 Narayan Man Bijukchhe noted that Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address called for achieving the reunification of the country in a peaceful way by concerted efforts of the Korean nation, adding that his party and the Nepali people fully support this.

articles.title: Meeting Held to Implement Tasks Set Forth in Kim Jong Un's New Year Address
articles.content:
Meeting Held to Implement Tasks Set Forth in Kim Jong Un's New Year Address
						
 Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- A meeting of members of youth shock brigade for northern railroads was held in Manpho City, Jagang Province on Wednesday to implement the important tasks set forth by the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address.
					 Present there were Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, officials concerned and members of the shock brigade.
					
					 A reporter and speakers recalled that Kim Jong Un indicated several times last year the orientation and ways for completing the project for reconstructing and repairing northern railways at an early date, true to the behests of leader Kim Jong Il, and showed profound love and trust for the members of the shock brigade.
					
					 They vowed to glorify the honor of the youth shock brigade in the construction this year greeting the 65th birthday of the DPRK and the 60th anniversary of the victorious Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 They called for waging a brisk mass technical innovation movement, true to the party's idea of breaking through the frontier of latest science and technology and thus devoting all their wisdom and energies to winding up the project earlier than scheduled and putting railroads on a scientific and modern basis.
					
					 They called upon all the shock brigade members to wage a dynamic struggle to make this a year of great victory and creation and innovations under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, holding high the banner of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.

articles.title: Bonfire Meeting of Those Engaged in Construction of Power Station Held
articles.content:
Bonfire Meeting of Those Engaged in Construction of Power Station Held 
						
 Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- A bonfire meeting of members of the Paektusan Songun Youth Shock Brigade was held at the construction site of the power station on Wednesday to implement the important tasks laid down by the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address. 
					 The bonfire was kindled by leading and active members of the shock brigade.
					
					 Kim Sang Min, chief of the shock brigade, said that the address serves as important guidelines indicating the path to be followed by Kim Il Sung's and Kim Jong Il's Korea and a banner calling on all the servicepersons and people to come out in the general advance to bring about a landmark turn in building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 He called upon the members of the shock brigade and other builders to effect innovations in the construction of dam of power station No. 1 and the building of power stations Nos. 2 and 3.
					
					 A poem "Our General Marshal Kim Jong Un" was recited to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The speakers expressed their resolution to display popular heroism and patriotic devotion in the construction of the power station this significant year greeting the 65th anniversary of the DPRK and the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. 
					
					 A chorus poem was recited to express the will of the shock brigade members to glorify their youthhood.

articles.title: DPRK People Intent on Study of Kim Jong Un's New Year Address
articles.content:
DPRK People Intent on Study of Kim Jong Un's New Year Address
						
 Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un's New Year address touched the heartstrings of the DPRK people.
					 The New Year address represents Kim Jong Un's steadfast will to glorify the dignity of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il's Korea all over the world.
					
					 Officials of ministries and national institutions, including the Ministry of Coal Industry, the Ministry of Electric Power Industry and the General Bureau of Public Service, are working out detailed plans for this year in line with the address to bring about a radical turn in the improvement of the people's standard of living and building an economic giant. They are meeting workers at the production and construction sites to find solutions to implementing the tasks set forth in the address.
					
					 Meanwhile, people across the country are intensively studying the address at home and working sites or in the rush hours.
					
					 Seen along the streets of the country are posters carrying such slogans as "Let us leap forward higher and faster on swift horses of science and technology!" and "Let's turn Sepho tableland into large-sized stockbreeding base!" which inspire the people in their efforts to implement the tasks advanced in the address.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime's Confrontation Moves Flailed
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime's Confrontation Moves Flailed
						
 Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un's New Year address instilled all Koreans at home and abroad with hope and confidence in national reunification.
					 However, the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors in south Korea is making desperate efforts to stop the nation's advance toward reconciliation, unity and independent reunification.
					
					 The group has kicked up the anti-DPRK confrontation racket and war moves from the outset of the year, making provocative remarks, staging live-firing artillery drill and other war games and scattering leaflets. Some days ago, it let Chon Yong U, chief for diplomacy and security of Chongwadae, spin out sophism to justify Lee's confrontation policy.
					
					 The Lee group committed heinous crimes against the nation in the last five years of its office. Not content with them, it is still trying to further aggravate the north-south relations and ignite a war.
					
					 Its last-ditch efforts have enraged the army and people of the DPRK.
					
					 Jo Chang Ho, 43, a citizen of Pyongyang, told KCNA:
					
					 "History knows no such vicious and stupid confrontation maniac as rat-like Lee Myung Bak and his group.
					
					 There is a limit to our magnanimity and patience. The rattish Lee group of traitors should be punished without mercy as it persistently stands against the interests of the nation and its reunification."

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats in Winning War
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats in Winning War
						
 Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- This year the Democratic People's Republic of Korea will greet the 60th anniversary of its victory in the Fatherland Liberation War (1950-1953).
					 In the New Year address, the dear respected Kim Jong Un said that the dignified and glorious present of the Korean people and the bright prosperous future of the country are ensured by the great achievements President Kim Il Sung made while leading the Fatherland Liberation War to brilliant victory on the strength of his outstanding strategy and tactics and wise leadership.
					
					 The last Fatherland Liberation War was an all-out war between the two-year-old DPRK and the U.S., which was boasting of being the strongest in the world.
					
					 On the day when the U.S. imperialists started a war against the DPRK, President Kim Il Sung ordered the units of the Korean People's Army to stop the enemies' surprise attack and switch over to counter-offensive, appealing to all the people to demonstrate the mettle of the Koreans.
					
					 In response to his order, the KPA liberated Seoul in three days after the outbreak of the war and seized over 90 percent of south Korea's territory inhabited with more than 92 percent of its population in a little more than one month.
					
					 When the KPA was undergoing a temporary strategic retreat, he took a measure for planned retreat in order to maintain its main forces and organize new anti-offensive units.
					
					 His distinguished strategy and tactics brought to naught the U.S. offensives step by step.
					
					 He foiled the battle of the small hilltop "T", prepared by the U.S. with so much effort as a prelude to "New Offensive", on the strength of sudden artillery strikes.
					
					 Thanks to his tactics, a KPA unit captured in 15 minutes the Height 351 which had been turned into a fortress by the enemy.
					
					 After all, the war ended in victory of the Korean people and the U.S. imperialists could not but sign the Armistice Agreement.

articles.title: New Activated Additives Popular in DPRK
articles.content:
New Activated Additives Popular in DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- Ultra-anthracite and low-grade coal are now widely used as fuel at factories and families in local areas of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, with introduction of activated additives which are helpful to raising combustion rate.
					 Kangwon Province built a production base of additives with a large capacity to provide them to industrial establishments and families.
					
					 With the additives, local industrial factories in the province fill up the shortage of fuel, lowering the production cost.
					
					 Most of counties in the province began operating coal briquette plants with help of additives. Co-op farms make slaked lime and organic fertilizer with the additives-mixed ultra-anthracite and low-grade coal as fuel.
					
					 A brisk drive for introduction of activated additives is going on in other parts of the country, too.
					
					 The activated additives were developed by a woman scientist at the Munphyong Smeltery. She was awarded an engineering doctorate for the invention.

articles.title: Defusing Inter-Korean Confrontation Called for
articles.content:
Defusing Inter-Korean Confrontation Called for 
						
 Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- All Koreans should resolutely stand up against the south Korean ruling quarters getting frantic with anti-reunification moves and wage a dynamic nationwide struggle to defuse the north-south confrontation. Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The developments on the Korean Peninsula in recent few years prove that distrust and misunderstanding between the compatriots in the north and the south cannot be wiped out nor can they trust and get reconciled with each other but they will only result in military conflicts and huge calamities unless an end is put to the policy of confrontation and war in south Korea. 
					
					 In order to defuse the confrontation between the north and the south it is necessary, first of all, to force the south Korean authorities to roll back their policy of confrontation as they take a hostile approach towards the ideology and social system in the north 
					
					 The anti-reunification forces in south Korea should immediately roll back the confrontation policy the injustice of which was clearly proved and opt for respecting the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and implementing them. They should stop at once war exercises and arms buildup increasing the military tension between the north and the south. They should refrain from all acts of stoking antagonism and distrust between compatriots and irritating the other side. This is a principled requirement for removing the confrontation between the north and the south to meet the aspiration and wishes of all Koreans as early as possible and opening up the way of independent reunification, peace and prosperity. 
					
					 It is the basic way of removing the confrontation between the north and the south under the present situation to implement the historic June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, a programme for implementing it.
					
					 All reunification movement organizations and personages at home and abroad should unite close under the banner of the June 15 joint declaration and boost mutual visits, contacts, solidarity and alliance, while intensifying the patriotic struggle to force the south Korean authorities to roll back their confrontation policy and promote national unity and reunification.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Thoroughly Rejecting Anti-Reunification Forces
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Thoroughly Rejecting Anti-Reunification Forces 
						
 Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- All Koreans should wage a dynamic struggle to bury the anti-reunification forces in the cemetery of history as they have escalated the confrontation on the Korean Peninsula, opposed to the improvement of the north-south relations.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group is becoming evermore reckless in its moves to escalate the confrontation with the north, antagonizing compatriots, utterly indifferent to the destiny of the country and the nation.
					
					 The Koreans can no longer overlook the fact that the confrontation racket of the Lee group more dead than alive is getting more frantic from the outset of the year, a grave threat to the destiny of the nation.
					
					 The group of traitors will never step down of their own accord.
					
					 All compatriots should turn out in the drive to beat the worst vicious maniacs hell-bent on confrontation and war.
					
					 All Koreans, be they in the north and the south and abroad, should come out in a dynamic struggle against the confrontation maniacs irrespective of ideology, social system, class and social stratum.
					
					 All fellow countrymen in the north and the south and abroad should wage a dynamic struggle against the anti-reunification forces full of firm confidence and optimism and thus unfailingly bring about a landmark turn in the drive for independent reunification, peace and prosperity this year.

articles.title: Preserving Independence and Peace Called for: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Preserving Independence and Peace Called for: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- Preserving independence and peace is a banner to be held fast to by the Korean people and progressive humankind, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a bylined article.
					 The article goes on:
					
					 Peace is a desire common to humankind and the essential requirement for popular masses in defending independence.
					
					 The imperialists' interference in internal affairs and military aggression against sovereign states on the international arena risk the peace and security of humankind.
					
					 At present, it is of very important significance in ensuring peace in the Asia-Pacific region to preserve peace and stability of the region, home to more than half of the world population.
					
					 In order to preserve regional peace and stability, the source of the danger of a war must be removed from the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Peace and stability in Asia and the rest of the world would be unthinkable without peace on the peninsula. 
					
					 Preserving peace on the peninsula means removing one of the fundamental factors posing a threat to the peace and stability in Asia and the rest of the world, and greatly advancing the human cause of peace.
					
					 Strengthening the defense capability amounts to a measure for self-defense in face of the imperialists' war moves.
					
					 Strong defense capabilities would help smash the imperialists' moves to ignite a war and preserve peace and stability in the region.
					
					 The Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government will make positive efforts to oppose aggression and war moves of the imperialists and preserve the regional peace and stability under the uplifted banner of independence and peace, the article concludes.

articles.title: Japanese Imperialists' Fabrication of "Hansong Treaty" Accused
articles.content:
Japanese Imperialists' Fabrication of "Hansong Treaty" Accused 
						
 Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- Newspapers Wednesday in bylined articles rap the Japanese imperialists for forcing the Korean Feudal Government to conclude the brigandish "Hansong (Seoul) Treaty" on January 9, 1885 after craftily torpedoing the Kapsin Coup.
					 Papers refer in detail to the background against which the Japanese imperialists cooked up the treaty. 
					
					 The Japanese imperialists were not pleased with the movement for bourgeois reform which occurred in Korea entering the 1880s and worked hard to torpedo it overtly and covertly. They did so because they were afraid that success in such movement might scuttle their plan for turning Korea into a monopolistic colony.
					
					 Resorting to a double-dealing tactics, the Japanese imperialists promised the enlightenment forces of Korea to provide them with funds and weapons for reform to tickle their fancy but they broke that promise under a groundless pretext. 
					
					 Meanwhile, they cunningly hinted troops of the Qing Dynasty which entered Korea at the request of the conservative group that a great event (bourgeois reform) might occur. 
					
					 When the Kapsin Coup for the bourgeois reform took place in 1884, the Japanese imperialists betrayed the enlightenment forces, driving the coup into a failure and hatched a sinister plot to invade Korea with it as a momentum. 
					
					 The Japanese resident minister set fire to the legation and spread the rumor that "the fire was set by Korean rioters." Japan mobilized armed forces for aggression under the pretext that it suffered "damage" during the coup. 
					
					 Japan worked out a "proposal for negotiations" peppered with lies and shifted all blames onto the Korean Feudal Government.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists faked up the above-said treaty by dint of threat and blackmail on January 9, 1885. By fabricating the treaty they wrested a huge amount of reparation from the Korean Feudal Government and provided conditions for subjugating Korea politically, economically and militarily. 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun says Japan has shunned the settlement of its past crimes, denying the acts of aggression up to this date. It urges Japan to settle its past as early as possible. 
					
					 Minju Joson says that Japan can never write off all the crimes it committed against the Korean nation in the past despite the flow of time.

articles.title: KBS Accuses Political Camp of Reneging on Its Promises
articles.content:
KBS Accuses Political Camp of Reneging on Its Promises
						
 Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- The south Korean KBS Monday accused the political camp of having reneged on its promises.
					 The broadcasting recalled that both ruling and opposition parties were vocal that they would reform their policies without fail during the "presidential" election campaign.
					
					 Their pledges to downgrade the privileged position of the lawmakers have already proved to be false, it deplored.
					
					 A pension budget for lawmakers which calls for paying 1.2 million won a month to each legislator bearing a "National Assembly" member badge even a day passed through the NA, noted the KBS, saying this touched off a firestorm of protest among different circles.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Czech Republic
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Czech Republic
						
 Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "The Great Comrade Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and People" was brought out in pamphlet by the Petr Hort Publishing House of the Czech Republic on Jan. 3.
					 The work, made public on April 20, 2012, deals with the revolutionary exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il all their life and indicates the tasks for firmly preserving and further glorifying their ideas and feats.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, January 9 (KCNA) -- Some political parties and public organizations of different countries made public statements in support of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's New Year Address.
					 The Communist Party of Chile (Proletarian Action) said in a statement on Jan. 1 hailed the New Year Address made by Kim Jong Un, noting that the address serves as a banner encouraging the Korean people and all other revolutionary people of the world in their struggle for sovereignty and socialism and a guiding principle for them.
					
					 The year 2013 will be a year of fresh victories for the DPRK, the statement pointed out.
					
					 The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea stated on the same day:
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un clarified some issues such as removing inter-Korean confrontation, carrying out to the letter the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and independently achieving national reunification by concerted efforts of the Korean nation. These indicated a fair and aboveboard way of putting an end to Korea's division and achieving Korea's reunification.
					
					 We are sure that no matter what trials and difficulties lie in the way of national reunification, Korea will surely emerge a reunified and prosperous thriving country under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The Workers' Party of Bangladesh and the Bangladesh National Socialist Party supported in a joint statement on Jan. 3 the efforts of the Workers' Party of Korea, the DPRK government and its people to effect a radical turn in building an economic giant and improving the people's standard of living with the same spirit and mettle as were displayed in conquering space and to build a reunified and prosperous thriving country without fail by concerted efforts of all Koreans.
					
					 The Peruvian Committee for Remembering Generalissimo Kim Jong Il on the same day carried a detailed gist of Kim Jong Un's New Year Address in a statement.
					
					 We positively support the New Year Address made by Kim Jong Un indicating the way for the Korean people and all other progressive people of the world to follow and extend solidarity to the Korean people in their cause of building an economic giant and achieving national reunification.

articles.title: Embajador cubano ofrece banquete
articles.content:
Embajador cubano ofrece banquete 
Pyongyang, 9 de enero (ACNC) -- El embajador de la Republica de Cuba en Corea, German Hermin Ferras Alvarez, ofrecio el dia 9 un banquete con motivo del 54o aniversario del Triunfo de la Revolucion Cubana.
					Fueron invitados el vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Yang Hyong Sop, el secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Yong Il, el canciller Pak Ui Chun, el presidente del Comite Coreano de Solidaridad con Cuba y del Comite de Educacion, Kim Sung Du, y otros funcionarios, los representantes diplomaticos de varios paises, los agregados militares de embajadas y los representantes de las organizaciones internacionales, acreditados en Corea. 
					
					Estuvieron presentes los miembros de la embajada cubana.
					
					El embajador cubano en su discurso dijo que el dia primero de enero de 1959, el pueblo cubano logro la independencia del pais al cabo de la ardua lucha contra los imperialistas.
					
					Se refirio a los grandes exitos que su pueblo obtiene en varias esferas aun en medio del bloque de los imperialistas.
					
					Continuo que el pueblo cubano se enorgullece de que tiene los lazos de amistad especiales con el heroico pueblo coreano guiado por el Comandante Supremo Kim Jong Un y expreso la voluntad de contribuir tambien en el futuro a fortalecer las relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises. 
					
					Le siguio en hacer uso de la palabra Yang Hyong Sop. 
					
					El recordo que bajo la acertada direccion del Partido Comunista de Cuba, el hermano pueblo cubano llevo adelante la causa socialista y le deseo mayores exitos en la materializacion de la resolucion del VI Congreso del PCC.
					
					Fortalecer y desarrollar las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises es la invariable posicion del gobierno de la RPDC, senalo y agrego que en el futuro tambien el pueblo coreano estara junto con el pueblo cubano en la lucha comun contra el imperialismo y por la causa socialista.

articles.title: Firmado convenio sobre la cooperacion economica y tecnica Corea-China
articles.content:
Firmado convenio sobre la cooperacion economica y tecnica Corea-China
						
Pyongyang, 9 de enero (ACNC) -- Quedo rubricado el dia 9 en esta capital el convenio sobre la cooperacion economica y tecnica entre los gobiernos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Republica Popular China. 
					En la ceremonia de firmas estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana el viceministro de Comercio Exterior Ku Pon Thae, el vicepresidente del Comite de Empresas Asociadas e Inversiones Ri Chol Sok y otros funcionarios, y por la china, los miembros de la delegacion economica y comercial gubernamental de China encabezada por el viceministro de Comercio Li Jinzao, el embajador Liu Hongcai y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica en Corea. 
					
					Por otra parte, fue rubricado el documento referido a la construccion de la Zona Economica y Comercial de Rason y el edificio del Comite de Administracion de la Zona Economica de Hwanggumphyong.

articles.title: VII reunion de comite de cooperacion Corea-China
articles.content:
VII reunion de comite de cooperacion Corea-China
						
Pyongyang, 9 de enero (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 9 en esta capital la VII reunion del Comite de Cooperacion en la Economia, el Comercio y la Ciencia y Tecnica entre los gobiernos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Republica Popular China. 
					Estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana el viceministro de Comercio Exterior Ku Pon Thae y otros funcionarios, y por la china los miembros de la delegacion economica y comercial gubernamental de China encabezada por el viceministro de Comercio Li Jinzao, el embajador Liu Hongcai y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica en Corea.
					
					En la ocasion se hicieron balance los exitos y experiencias logrados en el tiempo pasado en ampliar y desarrollar las relaciones economicas y comerciales entre los dos paises y se abordaron los temas de fomentar de cooperacion bilateral.

articles.title: En boga aditamento que eleva la tasa de combustion de carbon
articles.content:
En boga aditamento que eleva la tasa de combustion de carbon
						
Pyongyang, 9 de enero (ACNC) ? En estos dias, en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea se usan ampliamente la antracita de baja caloria y el carbon de poca calidad como combustibles industriales y domesticos.
					Esto se hizo posible gracias al aditamento que eleva la tasa de combustion, inventado por una cientifica de la Fundicion de Metales no Ferrosos de Munphyong.
					
					El aditamento aporta grandes utilidades en las zonas con abundantes yacimientos de esos combustibles fosiles.
					
					En particular, la provincia de Kangwon construyo una base que produce y distribuye el aditamento a las fabricas, granjas cooperativas y nucleos familiares locales.
					
					Las fabricas de industria local de esa provincia resolvieron el problema de combustible y rebajaron el costo de produccion usando la misma sustancia.
					
					Las granjas cooperativas producen la cal apagada y abonos organicos con los carbones tratados con aditamento.
					
					En reconocimiento de los meritos de la inventora, el Estado le concedio el titulo de persona benemerita de la era del Songun y doctora en ingenieria.
